topic.title: Managing Comments in a WebHelp with Feedback System

keywords.indexterm: WebHelp with Feedback comment managementmanage comments

body.p: When you installed the WebHelp with Feedback system, you should have been prompted to create an administrator account (or a user named administrator was created by default). As an administrator, you have access to manage comments posted in your feedback-enabled WebHelp system. You can also manage user roles and configure notification options.

To manage comments, user roles, or notification options, follow these steps:
At the bottom of each specific topic there is a Comments navigation bar and on the right side there is a Log in button. Click this button and log in with your administrator credentials. This gives you access to an Admin button.
Click the Admin button to display an administration panel inside the topic.
Use this panel to manage comments, user roles, or notification options.
The following options are available:
Delete comments To delete a comment â€¦
Notification options There are three types of notification options:
Reply notification Sends a notification when someone makes a reply to your comment.
Page notification Sends a notification if someone else adds a comment on the same page.
WebHelp notification Sends a notification if anyone makes a comment on any page in the WebHelp system.
Modify User Roles After a user creates an account, they will appear in the administration panel. Click the name of the user to change their role or notification options.
body.note: The key used for identifying the page a comment is attached to is the relative file path to the output page. Since the output file and folder names mirror the source, any change to the file name (or its folder) in the source will affect the comments associated with that WebHelp page. If you change the file name or path, the comment history for that topic will become orphaned (a change to the topic ID does not affect the comment history). You can view orphaned comments from the administrative panel.
